issue_comments.body:
Hello, in Tor browser, i can not submit the form where i add new Issue.
The "Submit new issue" button does not trigger any action. Dev. console says:
ReferenceError: module is not defined[Learn More]  ZeroPage.js:354:4
ReferenceError: module is not defined[Learn More]  ZeroFS.js:196:4
ReferenceError: module is not defined[Learn More]  ZeroAuth.js:89:4
ReferenceError: module is not defined[Learn More]  ZeroDB.js:242:4
ReferenceError: module is not defined[Learn More]  ZeroID.js:159:4

Thank you, but that does NOT work, because on the Linux server from which i planned to do git commands i have not created the gitcenter repository and do not have my gitcenter login ID. So yours mentioned commands fails because ...ZeroNet/data/1KR7WWJZwdezqEdSCPtChQGVdfgnBVhMPK... does not exist on that Linux server.

My computer from which i created gitcenter repository and have gitcenter login data is Windows 10.
Any work around on how to copy github repository data into gitcenter? I am not zeronet technical skilled user, rather GUI (Windows) person.

**Linux (headless, SSH only)**
> so you could download 1KR7WWJZwdezqEdSCPtChQGVdfgnBVhMPK and run git commands.

i do not know how and do not know how it can work while i am NOT authenticated as a owner of that git center repository on that headless Linux server (SSH access only)

**via Windows**

On Windows, i can authenticate into gitcenter via web browser and the zite with repo is probably already downloaded in my zeronet folder, but i have not Git installed on Windows, is that necessary to install Git on Windows (download and install many megabytes of data just to upload maybe 100 kb of files in my repo)?

Thanks anyway for kind tutorials you already posted.

I do not see the text of this issue, but this one seems similar: [Search feature for the "Issues" section](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/3@1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS)

@merithtk@zeroid.bit: The image does not show up in my case, it says the image contains errors. You can upload image on [Millchan](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1NcdNw3dsb9EVWGwJNsRyD4dzRLHMtPtGZ:file:0) for example.

issues.title: Subscription to issues via ZeroHello news feed
issues.body: Hello, i am sorry if i am blind, but when i create some issue, add reply to someone else issue or just want to watch some issue. How it is done, when i created issue, i do not see any indication if i am subscribed to new replies or status changes. Thank you

issues.title: How to clone Github repository into GitCenter repository?
issues.body:
Hello,

i know almost nothing about git, but my aim is to copy github repository into gitcenter.

i cloned the github repository by:

git clone https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroTalk.git

cd ZeroTalk

git push http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1KR7WWJZwdezqEdSCPtChQGVdfgnBVhMPK

but the result is: Failed connect to 127.0.0.1:43110; Connection refused

zeronet.py is running on background, it is a headless linux i use it as a proxy. Any idea what is the right command or how to debug this?

Is planned some feature which will allow importing github respository to gitcenter directly, just by entering github .git URL? Or importing .zip / tgz archive?

issues.title: Permanent link to a comments in "Issues"
issues.body:
Hello,

i wanted to link to one of the comments in the Issue i submitted.

It may be helpful to add hyperlink under post date or similar so one can copy the URL of a comment. Once this URL is visited by someone, it will somehow scroll the page to show the linked comment.

issues.title: Search feature for the "Issues" section
issues.body: It can be handy if one can search thru the "Issues" section to find if one is not creating duplicate issue.

issues.title: Ability to delete or rename repo
issues.body:
Hello,

i have not yet published my repo into the Repository Index

and i discovered it has bad name. I do not see how to rename it or delete it, i think it is important feature

and even if i published the repo to the index, i should have right for it to be deleted so it also do not make a mess either in the Index and in my Repo list.
